result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew Damon Thompson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: with credit for 5 days time served; STRAIGHT TIME.

miscConds.notes:
Submit a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
Pay all costs and surcharges or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.
Maintain full time employment/school or a combination of both.
AODA assessment/treatment deemed appropriate. Absolute sobriety.

records.addlTxt: JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Andrew Damon Thompson in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests a Plea and Sentencing date. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.

Defendant Andrew Damon Thompson in court. Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court previously.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Discussions of defendant's tardiness placed on the record. Court admonished defendant. Court ordered case adjourned for a Pretrial Conference. Court ordered defendant to report to Justice Point. Case adjourned to branch 24.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.

Defendant Andrew Damon Thompson in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Andrew Damon Thompson in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Defendant Andrew Damon Thompson in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
